comments.content: 24.75 in Q1, 24.75 in Q2, cut at end June to 23.75, cut at end July to 21.75%, so Q3 will average 22.42. If at end Sept it is cut to 19.75%, then Q3 may average 19.75%.

Assuming begins year at 19.75 and cuts to 19.25% in line with Fed cut. This leaves rates very positive, but I think SL may need to back the exchange rate this way. The year average would depend on which month the interest rate cut fell in.
This is the Treasury bill rate at C724IT@IFS
See scratch sheet
Just a guess, based on recent exchange rate stability and lower CPI.
Assuming July comes in at 7% and CPI ends year at 6.5%
Falling global food and oil prices
Lower than previously expected spending and project grants

https://www.statistics.sl/images/StatisticsSL/Documents/gdp/gdp_2024/GDP-Report_2024_Final_Publish.pdf p 8 says the figure is 4.4%,  but Economics  Unit did not agree to insert t his figure, as the World Bank has 4%. Presumably the WB will revise it up everntually.
Taken up slightly, partly to reduce the reisdual in  row 30 but also reflecting currency stability, which may encourage imports

Iron ore prices to fall by 12.9% see https://viewpoint.eiu.com/analysis/article/1982170398, but historically the export deflator doesn’t only follow iron ore prices.  I’m assuming high inflation in SL will offset the fall iron ore prices and preduce a small fall in export pirces than would be seen from iron ore alone.
Iron ore prices down by 3.4%, but 6% local CPI
Large fall in oil prices.
Large fall in global food prices
Taking the 1% rise in global industrial raw materials prices plus local inflation, approx
4.6% rise in global industrial raw materials prices plus local infltion
Forecast to be a little below CPI
Forecast to be below CPI, but higher than private consumption
Gvot expects revenue to be 12.5% of GDP https://viewpoint.eiu.com/analysis/article/422169242/
Govt expects 16.2% of GDP
Some figures at https://bsl.gov.sl/Monetary%20Policy%20Report_June%202025.pdf
P30 of https://bsl.gov.sl/Monetary%20Policy%20Report_June%202025.pdf shows export growth minimal
P29 of https://bsl.gov.sl/Monetary%20Policy%20Report_June%202025.pdf shows strong import growth, or at least in Q1 qoq
